required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Registry of St. Jude Medical Angio-Seal™ Vascular Closure Devices Following Interventional Radiology Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect data on the standard of care use of the St. Jude Medical (SJM) Angio Seal™ Evolution™ and V-Twist Integrated Platform (VIP) Devices in diagnostic and/or interventional radiology patient populations.

secondary_outcome.description: Time-to-hemostasis stratified into 3 categories: hemostasis in less than 1 minute alone or in combination with manual compression (standard of care), 1-5 minutes alone or in combination with manual compression (standard of care), and/or hemostasis achieved >5 minutes and/or with additional hemostasis methods required.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of Guided Access on Use of Closure Device.
secondary_outcome.description: The influence of fluoroscopy and/or ultrasound guided access on the decision to use a closure device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of Guided Access on Achieving Target Puncture Location.
secondary_outcome.description: The influence of fluoroscopy and/or ultrasound guided access on puncture location.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Major Vascular Complications (MVCs) by Guided Access Mode.
secondary_outcome.description: The influence of fluoroscopy and/or ultrasound guided access on Major Vascular Complications (MVCs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Minor Vascular Complications by Guided Access Mode.
secondary_outcome.description: The influence of fluoroscopy and/or ultrasound guided access on minor vascular complications.

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD) on Use of Closure Device
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of peripheral vascular disease (PVD) and its effect on the decision to use a closure device

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD) on Achieving Hemostasis by Device
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of peripheral vascular disease (PVD) and its effect on hemostasis. Initial hemostasis by device achieved.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Major Vascular Complications (MVC) by Presence of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of peripheral vascular disease (PVD) and its effect on Major Vascular Complications (MVC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Minor Vascular Complications by Presence of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD)
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of peripheral vascular disease (PVD) and its effect on minor vascular complications.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who undergo a diagnostic and/or interventional radiology procedure through percutaneous femoral artery access and meet the registry selection criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patient is undergoing a diagnostic and/or interventional radiology procedure via femoral arterial access and the investigator performing the procedure would use Angio-Seal for closure as part of his/her routine care of the patient. Angio-Seal deployment will follow the standard of care for vascular closure device use and the Instructions for Use (IFU) for the device.
2. Sheath angiography prior to Angio-Seal deployment reveals appropriate anatomy and puncture location for vascular closure device deployment.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who are unable to provide written informed consent.

outcome.title: Rate of Major Vascular Complications
outcome.population: 5 subjects underwent vascular closure with Angio-Seal on right and left sides.

group.title: Angio-Seal

event.sub_title: Vascular injury requiring repair via surgery or other means
New ipsilateral lower extremity ischemia requiring intervention

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Major and minor vascular complications were collected as Serious Adverse Event and Other Adverse Events as defined in the protocol.
